Can the bosom of Laura be cold,</br>Can she falsely abandon her friend?</br>Can the love she so oft did unfold,</br>Oh can it, be now at an end?
Fair truth seem'd to beam from her eye,</br>Sensibility glow'd on her cheek;</br>And she left me, methought, with a sigh;</br>—But perhaps it was all a mistake.
Perhaps she but feign'd to bestow</br>That praise she so sweetly could give:</br>Perhaps — but it cannot be so,</br>For my Laura could never deceive.
Oh ease my fond heart of its pain,</br>Convince me you still can be true:</br>The delightful assurance again,</br>With engaging persuasion renew.</br>
